events.message: The applicant has submitted a personal loan application to cover medical expenses related to a recent surgery.
The application was categorized under Personal Loan, as the purpose is to assist with medical debt payment.
A loan officer specializing in personal loans was assigned to review the applicant's medical expense needs.
The initial review evaluated the applicant’s credit history and reason for loan, focusing on medical-related debt relief.
Requested medical bills, proof of income, and identification documents to proceed with verifying loan application details.
Applicant submitted all requested documents including hospital invoices, wage statements, and a valid ID copy.
A credit check was performed showing the applicant’s credit score to be within an acceptable risk range.
Risk assessment concluded that the applicant has moderate risk but sufficient income to cover monthly payments.
The loan offer was presented to the applicant, including interest rate, repayment schedule, and loan amount approval.
Applicant confirmed understanding of loan terms and expressed willingness to accept the proposed repayment plan.
The personal loan was officially approved following all reviews and positive feedback from the applicant.
Loan funds were disbursed to the applicant’s bank account to cover the outstanding medical bills as requested.
A follow-up call was made to ensure the applicant received the funds and address any further questions.
The personal loan case was successfully closed after confirming the applicant’s satisfaction and completion of initial payment setup.
